title: "Adult-born dentate granule cells support the activity of hippocampal cell populations"
excerpt: "The dentate gyrus (DG) is a region of the mammalian brain known to support the encoding of new memories. This brain region is part of the hippocampal formation, a set of brain regions involved in vital memory functions."
